articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Joe Biden will sign a bill into law on Wednesday that provides billions of dollars of new aid to Ukraine for its war with Russia, a bipartisan victory for the president as he seeks re-election and a boost to allies who have looked to Washington to support Kiev.
articles.title: After battle with Republicans, Biden to sign Ukraine aid package

articles.author: Steve Holland, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The United States in recent weeks secretly shipped long-range missiles to Ukraine for use in its battle to fight off Russian invaders, and Ukraine has now used them twice, a U.S. official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: The US quietly shipped long-range ATACMS missiles to Ukraine

articles.author: Alexander Ratz, Diego Oré, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Germany is waging a charm offensive inside the Republican Party. Japan is lining up its own Trump whisperer. Mexican government officials are talking to Camp Trump. And Australia is busy making laws to help Trump-proof its U.S. defense ties.
articles.title: Trump 2.0: How U.S. allies are working to iron out the bugs

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli warplanes pounded the northern Gaza strip for a second day on Wednesday in a fierce assault that has shattered weeks of comparative calm, and Israel said it was moving forward with plans for an all-out assault on Rafah in the south.
articles.title: Israel says Rafah assault looms; massive Gaza airstrikes end weeks of relative calm

articles.author: Jonathan Allen, Brendan O'Brien
articles.description: Columbia University students agreed to take down "a significant number" of the dozens of tents set up on the school's main campus as part of a protest against Israel's incursion into Gaza, the New York school said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Columbia extends protest deadline after students agree to dismantle some tents

articles.author: Belén Carreño, Jesús Aguado
articles.description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is no stranger to high octane political battles and has successfully fought for his career in public life several times.
articles.title: Spanish PM Sanchez shocks country again putting his continuity on the line

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: TikTok's chief executive said on Wednesday that the company expects to win a legal challenge to block legislation signed into law by President Joe Biden that he said would ban the popular short video app used by 170 million Americans.
articles.title: TikTok CEO expects to defeat US ban: 'We aren't going anywhere'

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Russia on Wednesday vetoed a U.S.-drafted United Nations Security Council resolution that called on countries to prevent an arms race in outer space, a move that prompted the United States to question if Moscow was hiding something.
articles.title: Russia, US clash at UN over nuclear weapons in space

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Shanghai on Wednesday with U.S.-China ties on a steadier footing, but with a daunting array of unresolved issues threatening the stability of relations between the global rivals.
articles.title: Better US-China ties but still deep disagreements as Blinken starts visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazil's government submitted proposed rules to Congress on Wednesday to carry out a historic tax overhaul approved last year, a key element of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva's strategy to foster growth in Latin America's largest economy.
articles.title: Brazil's government submits rules to streamline consumption taxes
